intro: Centaurea phrygia subsp. ratezatensis, commonly known as the Caucasian centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny stems and blue to purple flowers. The species belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptability to harsh environments. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Centaurea species.
